channel.title: Posts on Salman Ali Banani
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Salman Ali Banani

item.title: Docker Scratchpad
item.description: This is a collection of useful Docker commands. Containers and Images Show all running containers: docker ps Shows all running and stopped containers: docker ps -a Shows only CONTAINER IDs of all running and stopped containers: docker ps -aq Stop all running containers: docker container stop $(docker container ls -aq) Remove all containers: docker container rm $(docker container ls -aq) Show all top level images: docker images Remove all images: docker rmi $(docker images -aq) Dockerfile Build image from Dockerfile in the current directory with tag “sometag”: docker build -t sometag .

item.title: Migrating My Blog to Hugo & Netlify
item.description: I moved my blog from wordpress.com to Netlify and started using Hugo to generate site content from my Markdown files. I love the workflow, and I now don’t pay for stuff I don’t use.

item.title: Pushing Secrets Into Azure Key Vault Directly From Arm Template
item.description: Another way to push secrets from Azure DevOps to a Key Vault using an ARM template’s output.

item.title: Philosophy for Software Developers
item.description: Bertrand Russell has been an inspiring influence on me since my university years. This post is inspired by his thoughts on why Philosophy is useful.

item.title: Storing Secrets in Azure Key Vault from Azure Devops Release Pipeline
item.description: Steps to use Azure Key Vault from an Azure DevOps Release pipeline.

item.title: Scrum and Empiricism
item.description: Scrum demonstrates a scientific orientation towards project management. It’s foundations in empiricism make it a scientific enterprise.

item.title: It's Not Just the Bell Curve
item.description: During the life of a Scrum project, the scrum team develops a shared understanding of how much effort a story point actually represents. This shared sense of worth of a story point makes estimates more accurate over time.

item.title: Story Points - A Mathematical Perspective
item.description: Story points are a useful measure of effort required for a task, even though they are not accurate. During the life of a project, the overestimates will cancel out the underestimates over many sprints. The Bell Curve provides a mathematics-based intuition for that assertion.

item.title: About
item.description: I am a Senior Consultant at Telstra Purple, one of the top IT consulting firms in Australia. I specialize in web development using ASP.NET MVC, JavaScript, HTML, CSS etc. I live in Sydney, Australia with my family.
